snippet: The Federal Government will spend up to $25 million to help California workers, giving them temporary jobs in cleanup and relief efforts as the state struggles through a string of winter storms, Labor Secretary Alexis M. Herman said today.     ''W...
lead_paragraph: The Federal Government will spend up to $25 million to help California workers, giving them temporary jobs in cleanup and relief efforts as the state struggles through a string of winter storms, Labor Secretary Alexis M. Herman said today. ''We're committed to doing everything possible to help the families whose lives and livelihoods are being overturned by these devastating floods,'' Ms. Herman said.
abstract: us pledges $25 million for california workers**Labor Secretary alexis M Herman pledges $25 million for California flood relief; money is earmarked to hire workers who have lost their jobs to participate in cleanup effort (S)

headline.main: U.S. Pledges $25 Million for California Workers
